Aphids.Symptoms: Angular leaf spots with red to brown margins, water-soaked lesions that become necrotic
Aphids.Preventive_measures: Use disease-free seeds, practice crop rotation, avoid overhead irrigation
Organic: Azadirachtin 00.03% EC Min. Neem Oil Based Spray 2000 g/ml of formulation diluted in 500 liters of water per hectare, with a waiting period of 5 days before harvest
Amruth Alestra Liquid  containing Verticillium lecanii with dosage of 2ml/Litre of water
release parasitoid like Aphelinus sp., to effectively control cotton aphids’ populations
Release natural predators such as lady bird beetles, green lacewing, hoverflies and spiders etc
using neem products,detergent / soap powder @ 1 gm/litre of spray fluid is to be added for getting uniform spray suspension
Spray of 5 % neem seed kernel extract prepared on farm or crude neem oil spray @ 1%

Army worm.Symptoms: Caterpillars feeding on leaves, creating holes and skeletonizing foliage
Army worm.Preventive_measures: Regular monitoring, use of pheromone traps, biological control with natural predators
Organic: Release egg parasitoids like Trichogramma pretiosum or Telenomus remus 50,000 per acre at weekly
Anand Dr. Bacto’s Brave ( Beauveria bassiana) (dosage: 2.5ml per liter of water.)
Katyayani Organic Larvicide (Bacillus thuringiensis )(dosage:10ml per liter of water. )
Econeem Plus Bio pesticide (Azadirachtin )(dosage:3ml per litre as oviposition deterrent on one week after sowing)
Deep ploughing and application of neemcake (dosage:  50–100 mL/ha)
Common predators include big-eyed bugs, minute pirate bugs, damsel bug, lacewing larvae, assassin bugs, spiders, lady beetles and Collops beetles.

Bacterial Blight.Symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves, stems, and bolls, leading to wilting and defoliation
Bacterial Blight.Preventive_measures: Use resistant varieties, apply copper-based bactericides, ensure proper field sanitation
Organic: Seaweed Extracts: These can boost plant immunity and help them resist bacterial infections
Mulching: Mulching can prevent the spread of soil-borne bacteria to the leaves
V-Cure Fungicide Plus Bactericide

Cotton Boll Rot.Symptoms: Soft, mushy bolls with a foul odor, often with fungal growth
Cotton Boll Rot.Preventive_measures: Improve air circulation, avoid excessive nitrogen fertilization, timely harvesting

Curl Virus.Symptoms: Leaf curling, yellowing, and stunted growth
Curl Virus.Preventive_measures: Use virus-free seeds, control vector populations, apply insecticides
Organic: canola oil and bifenthrin (bifenthrin10% EC)
Azardiractin  (Brand: Greenpeace Neemol Bio Neem Oil Insecticide : Neem Oil extracts)  (dosage:1 – 2 ml/lit water )
Fatty Acid based Plant Extracts (Brand:  Nanobee Agrokill Insecticide : Nano Colloidal Micelles 100%) (dosage:3 mL/Litre )
Beauveria bassiana (Brand: Anand Dr Bacto’s Brave)  (dosage:2.5 ml/lit water)
VC-100  (dosage:5 gram/Litre water )
Vanproz V-Bind (dosage: 2 – 3 ml/lit water)
Multiplex Magnum Mn (Manganese 12% ) (dosage: 2.5 ml/lit water)
Foliar application of neem leaf extract and 1% neem oil
Neem oil + Teepol   (dosge: 3 + 500 ml/ha)
Fish oil resin soap   (dosage: 14/15 kg/ha)

Herbicide Growth Damage.Symptoms: Distorted growth, leaf chlorosis, and necrosis due to herbicide exposure
Herbicide Growth Damage.Preventive_measures: Follow label instructions, avoid drift, use appropriate herbicide rates

Leaf Hopper Jassids.Symptoms: Yellowing and curling of leaves, stunted plant growth
Leaf Hopper Jassids.Preventive_measures: Use resistant varieties, apply insecticides, maintain field hygiene
Organic: spinosad- fermented soil actinomycete bacteria {active ingredients: Spinosyn A and Spinosyn D} (dosage: 0.35ml/L on infected area )
Release predators viz., Chrysopa carnea (green lacewing)
Neem Seed Kernel Extract %5 {50 grams of ground neem seed kernels per liter of water} (dosage:25 kg/hectare)
aqueous neem seed extract (dosage: 10gram/Litre sprayed at 10 days interval)
Insecticidal soaps
Metarhizium anisopliae (Green Muscardine)
Beauveria bassiana (Green Mold/Beauveria)
Paecilomyces fumosoroseus (Violet Mold/Paecilomyces)
bacterium, Bacillus thuringiensis var. kurstaki (Garden Dust)
larvae of ladybird beetles and lacewings, spiders
Anagrus atomus (fairyfly or leafhopper egg parasitoid)
Azadirachtin 00.03% WSP (300 PPM) Neem Oil Based (dosage:Apply 2500-5000 g/ml of formulation diluted in 500-1000 liters of water per hectare, with a waiting period of 7 days before harvest.)

Leaf Redding.Symptoms: Reddening of leaves, often due to nutrient imbalances or environmental stress
Leaf Redding.Preventive_measures: Correct nutrient deficiencies, ensure proper irrigation, avoid water stress

Leaf Variegation.Symptoms: Irregular leaf coloration, often genetic or due to viral infections
Leaf Variegation.Preventive_measures: Select healthy plants, control viral vectors, apply balanced fertilizers
Organic: no direct environmental cause for this disorder, no biological treatment are available to treat it

Powdery Mildew.Symptoms: White powdery fungal growth on leaves and stems
Powdery Mildew.Preventive_measures: Ensure good air circulation, apply fungicides, avoid overhead irrigation
Organic: bacteria (Bacillus circulans and Serratia marcescens) have been used to control.
Sulfur and Fish Oil + Sesame Oil
Neem oil
Milk

Target Spot.Symptoms: Circular spots with concentric rings on leaves, leading to defoliation
Target Spot.Preventive_measures: Apply fungicides, remove infected debris, ensure proper spacing

Wilt.Symptoms: Sudden wilting of plants, often due to fungal or bacterial infections
Wilt.Preventive_measures: Use resistant varieties, improve soil drainage, apply fungicides
Organic: Apply farm yard manure or other organic manures (dosage: 4 ton/acre)
Trichoderma asperellum : Biocontrol Agent: It suppresses the growth of plant pathogens such as Fusarium, (dosage: 1 kg/ acre, twice in the soil during sowing and 90 DAS )
T. asperellum : A fungus acts as a Biocontrol agent (dosage: 1 kg/ 100kg of manure for 15 days )
Increase in soil temperature (Soil solarization) decreases the incidence of wilt
